meanings.definition: A genetic disorder characterized by excessive iron absorption in the body.
meanings.sent1: Hemochromatoses can cause health problems due to too much iron in the body.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed him with hemochromatoses after noticing high iron levels.
meanings.sent3: When the superhero accidentally swallowed a magnet, he joked about developing hemochromatoses.
meanings.sent4: Her love for collecting old coins was like hemochromatoses, slowly accumulating and overwhelming her.
meanings.sent5: The image of iron particles flooding his system stuck with him, a vivid picture of hemochromatoses.

meanings.definition: The condition of having too much iron in the blood.
meanings.sent1: She felt fatigued and dizzy, symptoms of hemochromatoses affecting her blood.
meanings.sent2: The blood test revealed his hemochromatoses, explaining his iron overload.
meanings.sent3: The vampire joked that humans with hemochromatoses were his favorite snacks.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the iron in his blood felt like a burden, a heavy cloak of hemochromatoses.
meanings.sent5: The redness of his blood seemed to glow unnaturally, a sign of hemochromatoses to the doctor.
